title: How Many Calories Are in 5 Eggs?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in 5 eggs, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
h1: How Many Calories Are in 5 Eggs?
assumptions: Large eggs (~50 g each), hard-boiled, no added salt/oil.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, brand, and preparation; toppings or seasonings change values. Check packaging when available.

quick_answer.text: Five large boiled eggs provide ~390 kcal and ~31.5 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Fried in 1 tsp oil per egg

faqs.q: How many calories in 5 boiled eggs?
faqs.a: About 390 kcal for five large boiled eggs.

faqs.q: What are the macros for 5 eggs?
faqs.a: ≈31.5 g protein, 26.5 g fat, 3 g carbs.

faqs.q: Do 5 eggs have fiber or much carbs?
faqs.a: 0 g fiber and ~3 g carbs total.

faqs.q: Why is cholesterol high in 5 eggs?
faqs.a: Most in the yolk; five large eggs ≈930 mg.

faqs.q: Does egg size affect calories in 5 eggs?
faqs.a: Yes—medium eggs lower, extra-large higher. Adjust by size.
